name: Threshold
author: Nipype (interface)
description:
Threshold, as implemented in Nipype (module: nipype.interfaces.fsl.maths, interface: Threshold).

Use fslmaths to apply a threshold to an image in a variety of ways.

inputs.name: Args
inputs.description: A string. Additional parameters to the command.

inputs.name: Direction
inputs.description: 'below' or 'above'. Zero-out either below or above thresh value.

inputs.name: Environ
inputs.description: A dictionary with keys which are a bytes or none or a value of class 'str' and with values which are a bytes or none or a value of class 'str'. Environment variables.

inputs.name: In file
inputs.description: A pathlike object or string representing an existing file. Image to operate on.

inputs.name: Internal datatype
inputs.description: 'float' or 'char' or 'int' or 'short' or 'double' or 'input'. Datatype to use for calculations (default is float).

inputs.name: Nan2zeros
inputs.description: A boolean. Change nans to zeros before doing anything.

inputs.name: Out file
inputs.description: A pathlike object or string representing a file. Image to write.

inputs.name: Output datatype
inputs.description: 'float' or 'char' or 'int' or 'short' or 'double' or 'input'. Datatype to use for output (default uses input type).

inputs.name: Output type
inputs.description: 'nifti' or 'nifti_pair' or 'nifti_gz' or 'nifti_pair_gz'. Fsl output type.

inputs.name: Use nonzero voxels
inputs.description: A boolean. Use nonzero voxels to calculate robust range.

inputs.name: Use robust range
inputs.description: A boolean. Interpret thresh as percentage (0-100) of robust range.

output-files.name: Out file
output-files.description: A pathlike object or string representing a file. Image written after calculations.
